In Julia, Write a function `ispersonal` that returns a trait if the provided Vehicle type is a personal vehicle for everyday driving. All vehicles are subtypes of AbstractVehicle. Function must work for types: Car, Motorcycle, Bus, Truck. The first two should return true, the latter two should return false . The function should default to false for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle. Provide an example.

In Julia, you can define a trait `ispersonal` using a Union type and overloading the `==` operator to check if a vehicle is one of the personal types. Here's how you can implement it:

```julia
abstract type AbstractVehicle end

struct Car <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Motorcycle <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Bus <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Truck <: AbstractVvehicle end

# Define a union type for personal vehicles
PersonalVehicle = Union{Car, Motorcycle}

# Overload the == operator to check if a vehicle is personal
function Base.==(vehicle::AbstractVehicle, ::Type{PersonalVehicle})
    return (typeof(vehicle) <: Car || typeof(vehicle) <: Motorcycle)
end

# Define the ispersonal function
ispersonal(vehicle::AbstractVehicle) = vehicle == PersonalVehicle ? true : false

# Example usage
julia> ispersonal(Car())  # should return true
true

julia> ispersonal(Motorcycle())  # should return true
true

julia> ispersonal(Bus())  # should return false
false

julia> ispersonal(Truck())  # should return false
false
```

In this example, `Car` and `Motorcycle` are considered personal vehicles for everyday driving, while `Bus` and `Truck` are not. The `ispersonal` function checks if the vehicle is a member of the `PersonalVehicle` union type using the overloaded `==` operator. For any other subtype of `AbstractVehicle` that is not explicitly defined in the `==` operator, the default return value of `false` will be used.
